description: Runaway League One leaders Birmingham celebrated a club-record 37th win of the season as Jay Stansfield's late penalty secured a 2-1 victory over relegation-threatened Bristol Rovers at the Memorial Stadium.
title: Bristol Rovers 1-2 Birmingham City: Match report
title_page: Bristol Rovers 1-2 Birmingham City: Match report - BBC Sport
maintext:
Bristol Rovers have won just one of their 13 league games against Birmingham City (D8 L4), a 1-0 home victory in January 1980.
After winning the reverse fixture 2-0 in December, Birmingham City will be looking to record a first ever league double over Bristol Rovers.
Bristol Rovers have won just one of their last nine midweek (Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday) league fixtures (D2 L6), although that was their most recent, a 3-2 victory over Bolton in March.
Birmingham City have picked up 32 points away from home in League One this season, their most on the road in a single league campaign since 2008-09 (36), when they were promoted from the Championship to the Premier League.
